result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin K Diedrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Burglary-Armed w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  May Not have contact with victims (not to be within 2500 ft of house or work).  May not possess any firearms.

Attorneys Michael Graveley and Margaret Drees appear for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Alex Flynn. Victims present in court.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 330 - PSI has been reviewed by all parties. Victim statements. Sentence recommendations. Restitution of $5617.59 ordered. Sentence: 
Ct1:   Defendant is sentenced to 17.5 years in the WSP; 12.5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
Ct2:   Defendant is sentenced to 17.5 years in the WSP; 12.5 years Initial Confinement followed by years of Extended Supervision.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Michael Graveley and Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State and KSD Detective Jon Hasselbrink.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Flynn and Attorney Kori Ashley.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Day 2.  State files amended information.  Atty Flynn acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/22/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.  Juror's are excused at 10:06am.

Testimony taken from:  KSD Deputy Nicole Sorensen, Margaret C., KSD Detective Jason Sielski, Dr. Leo Treysman, KSD Deputy Bryan Easter, Richard C., Edward T., KSD Deputy Daniel Bella. Attorney Michael Graveley and Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Flynn.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of jury selection date due to Judge availability the week of 4/18/16.  Atty Flynn objects to adjournment of trial.  DDA Graveley states that based on discussion of parties off the record they have a new trial date that would work for both parties, including the defense expert, on 7/11/16 at 8:30am.  Atty Flynn agrees.  So ordered; JS is adjourned from 4/18/16 at 8:30am to 7/11/16 at 8:30am; DDA Graveley to send list of witnesses the State intends to call to Atty Flynn within 14 days.  Bond continued.
